title: Levélszemét gyűjtése
content:
Üdvözlöm!

Magyar nyelvű Thunderbird a levelezőm. Egy biztosan hozzám küldött e-mail nem érkezett meg, már korábban is volt ilyen gyanúm, hogy elvesznek leveleim. Kerestem volna azokat, de nem találtam olyan foldert, amiben lehetnének. Kérdéseim: - mi lenne a spam/trash/junk/szemét folder neve a magyar nyelvű installálás esetén? - nekem kell kijelölni? Hová a könyvtár struktúrában? (nem találtam rá utalást a Help-ben) - van bármilyen automatizmus a szemét leválasztására akkor is, ha én nem állítottam be szabályokat? - mi történik a levélszemétnek minősített levelekkel, ha nincs az első kérdésben említett spam folder?

Köszönöm előre is, 

  Páldi Vince
creator: vpaldi

title: vai a data
content: Buongiorno, vorrei sapere se è possibile inserire un pulsante o comando per andare ad una data precisa, anche nel passato, così come si fa con il pulsante "vai a oggi". Esiste un componente aggiuntivo che possa svolgere tale funzione? Grazie M

content:
When using Thunderbird the font size will change when I am working on a new document and usually when I am half way through typing the email. It is so frustrating. Why in one paragraph are there words in a medium font and in other words that are half the size and are identified as large.

title: "failed" message stuck in Thunderbird from months ago, error message box pops up every day or so, 4 or 5 times a day
content:
Thunderbird 102.9.0 Windows 10 I guess I have a "failed" message stuck in Thunderbird on my work computer from months ago. Error message box pops up probably every couple days, then for a few days in a row, then not for a few days. When it comes up there are normally 3 or 4 instances, have to close each one.

Picture of error message attached.

When the error box pops up it prevents the sent and inbox folders from syncing - I don't think it stops messages from sending (I use the Send Later add-on regularly) - which means when I go to look at my emails on my phone or home computer the folders will not refresh till I get back to my work computer and clear the error.

Last emailed this person back in November (11 emails sent total) and had this message once around that time, called him and he confirmed email came through.

Appreciate any suggestions.
creator: gord3

title: SMTP on exchange issue
content: With upgrade from 102.8 to 102.9, a new problem with connection to MS exchange enterprise server has arisen. The server will now not let me send mail through the SMTP connection. I can receive mail without a problem. My university uses 2fa (DUO push). The connection that has worked in the past uses smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, and OAuth2. When I try to send now, I get this error dialog: "Login to server smtp.office365.com with username xxx@xxx.edu failed." [I've redacted that username]. When I choose "Enter New Password", no authentication dialog boxes come up. It just times out with the same error dialog. I'm not getting a 2fa push notice either. Any ideas on what to do next? Thanks.

title: Rearranging Inbox Folders
content:
I work with Ver.102.9.0 with 2 Inboxes. One bares my POP3 Server's name, the other with a Different name inherited from a previous Provider when I joined my current one. Each Inbox was named (say) 'MyOldAddress'.com and 'MyCurrentAddress.com' by my new Provider.

They automatically (I assumed?) stacked in alphabetical order (along with their normal subfolders) and then - because I wanted to have my 'Old' address folders at the top - I must have prefixed them 'A- OldAddress.com' and 'B- CurrentAddress.com', to have them placed in the order I wanted them to be. Probably soon after I installed Tbird and migrated my message history from Windows Live Mail I assume?

So might I now safely rename both (after backing up the Profiles) by deleting those additiional 'A-' and 'B-' pre-fixes without losing their sub-folders along with their archived message date history?
creator: peetrobo

title: perdita del contenuto di mail
content: Stiamo abbandonando l'operatore Fastweb e quindi anche l'email. Ho trasferito le mail di mia moglie (più di 2000!) da Fastmail a Thunderbird, dove avevo posizionato (scusate i termini atecnici) anche l'account fastweb. Poi ho creato delle cartelle locali, dove trasferire quanto c'era nelle cartelle Fastweb. Il trasferimento della posta inviata (circa 150) è riuscito senza problemi. Quello della posta ricevuta (oltre 2000 messaggi), inizialmente sembrava riuscita, ma poi improvvisamente è sparito il contenuto di gran parte di esso (circa 1600 messaggi), nel senso che la cartella dice che ci sono ancora quasi 2000 nmessaggi (di cui 9 da leggere), ma il contenuto è completamente bianco. Posso fare qualcosa per recuperare il contenuto dei messaggi spariti? Premetto che, non so perché, quando ho abilitato Thunderbird per fastweb, da Fastmail online sono spariti tutti i messaggi. Inoltre, nn tecnico informatico, che opera nel quartiere, dopo aver tenuto il pc per un giorno, ha detto che non è possibile fare alcunché. Scusatemi per il disturbo e grazie per qualunque suggerimento possiate darmi
creator: mirlimau

content: My Thunderbird beta updated when I opened it this morning. Despite looking everywhere, adjusting what I could, and spending time undoing and redoing settings in an attempt to get the columns to appear in my display, I could not get it to happen. I have no columns and can only display the email list as taller rows, limiting the number of emails listed to less than half of what it used to be. I also cannot click on any button (because they are unavailable) to show an email as read/unread, cannot see the junk mail icon lit up, sort by attachments, date, name, show priority level, etc. I still have the regular version of Thunderbird installed because I know beta can be glitchy. I will use that until I can find a way to display my emails using the columns and not just the rows with limited information. I would love to know how to fix this. I have looked and tried everything I can think of. Any suggestions?

title: Cannot connect network calendar
content:
I am self-hosting a EteSync server in my home and have the EteSync-Dav software setup on my local machine. When I connect to the calendar link associated with my EteSync account directly and input my credentials it successfully downloads a .ics file. However, when I attempt to connect to my calendar using the exact same link in Thunderbird it results in this error message: "Could not find calendars at this location. Please check your settings." I've gone back through the entire process of setting up my EteSync server and the EteSync-Dav adapter to rule out user-error multiple times and I wanted to check and verify that this wasn't just simply a bug on Thunderbird's side. My hunch has been that this is likely an SSL cert issue, since the EteSync-Dav adapter was setup with an SSL cert, but the cert is installed at the OS level, so I am not sure why this would be the case. I even tried to manually import the cert into Thunderbird with no luck.

Thank you in advance.
creator: InverseCosine

Who knows a solution or can someone check this and solve this?

title: How to avoid that the orriginal messages turns blue when I respond on it?
content: Since some time - and I am a long time user - when I react to a message that someone sent me, the original message no longer has black characters but they are turned into blue. I have no idea why this happens and I have not changed anything in my preferences, so think it is part of an "upgrade" of Thunderbird. I'm not happy with it, because if I make a print of my answer - on a black and white laser printer - I cannot read the original message anymore. So I have to make a separate print of the original message after I printed my answer to it. I now have to make two prints and use more paper, where I normally had to make only one print. I looked around under preferences, but found no option to correct this new habit of Thunderbird. :-((. I hope there is someone who knows how I can turn this new thing off and maybe there is someone at Thunderbird who understands that this "new nice blue thing" is not a good upgrade as I now have to make a lot more prints than before. Thanks in advance!

title: Most mail going to Spam Folder
content: I recently installed a replacement Desktop computer and installed Thunderbird as is on my laptop. I Sync both machines. Under my old setup both Spam and Junk worked fine with Junk going to Junk folder and nothing to Spam that I remember. Now about 80% to 90% of incoming mail goes to Spam folder on both machines and I can't find any way to fix it. No settings for Spam. 1) I have entered good mail addresses into my address book in both computers. 2) I have selected Not Junk for all good mail on both machines several times. Can't find a way to select Not Spam. 3) Windows 11 on desktop & Windows 10 on Laptop. Still no improvement and most mail going to Spam. Would it help to turn off Sync? Any help or ideas would be greatly appreciated as I would really like to stay with Thunderbird if I can. Currently I am checking my Spam folder before the Inbox.
creator: jfinchum1

title: Thunderbird 102.9.0 hangs (Ubuntu linux 22.04)
content:
Hello. For the last week or so, Thunderbird has become unusable for me. Shortly after doing anything, such as clicking on a message, it hangs and I can get nothing else done. If I go to another window, and then back to thunderbird, it redraws the window frame, but with transparent window contents (the underlying screen is visible). My "top" linux command shows that thunderbird is eating 100% CPU (on only one thread of the multithreaded 12th Gen core i7).

I've looked at the Activity Manager before the freezing, and nothing untoward is reported. After the freeze, Activity just opens as another transparent window, so I don't know if anything is happening.

I tried resetting the global index as was suggested in another post here. It indexed all my boxes without any error but was not changed afterwards.

I'd really appreciate suggestions here. I'm not aware of having done anything such as a change of settings, so it has me beaten at the moment. I've been using Thunderbird for years without seeing this before.

Kenneth.
creator: mozilla411

title: Lost all subfolders when updating to 112.0b1
content: I lost all of my subfolders when updating to TB version 112.0b1 today. I have read a ton of articles and none seemed offer a solution (or least not a solution that worked or I could understand). It appears these missing folders are in the following folder: (C) > Users > AppData > Roaming > Thunderbird > Profiles > 3lqu3vu8.default > Mail > mail.comcast.net > Sent.sbd > Storage Folders.sbd > Inbox Storage.sbd The names and size of the subfolders seem to be a perfect match for what is missing. How can get this folders (or the information in these folders) back into the Inbox? Any help will be greatly appreciated.

title: Huge issues with recent Thunderbird update
content: I updated Thunderbird yesterday, and the program is a disaster now. Parts of toolbars are missing or are totally relocated. Functions are not working properly; e.g, I can't filter by field, and when I try to type in the filter field, the letters are not coming out correctly as I type them in. I can use tags, although the "tag" function is not properly located, but when I select a tag, the tag the color I assigned to it doesn't show when I go back to the inbox. I am using Windows 11 Home Version, which I updated right before the Thunderbird update; everything else is fine. Is there a way I can get back to the old version, and if so, will I have to wipe everything out and start over? The last time I did this there were numerous problems and I had to pay my computer guy close to $1000.00 to fix them; even then, some problems remained. Thank you!
